intro: Guarania ramiflora, commonly known as the branched guarania, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features a woody stem with branching patterns, and its leaves are alternate and ovate in shape. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is adapted to thrive in moist, shaded environments. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
